order.dummy (you can delete this line): you will be buying with order size (in BNB) the expected_amount of X tokens. eg. size=1.5 / expected_amount=8000 -> you will spend 1.5BNB to buy (at least) 8000 tokens.

token.address: address of the token to snipe. eg: 0x0e09fabb73bd3ade0a17ecc321fd13a19e81ce82
token.pair_address: address of the paired token in the LP. Probably WBNB (99%). eg: 0xbb4CdB9CBd36B01bD1cBaEBF2De08d9173bc095c

accounts.admin: admin is the administrator / deployer of the contracts. this address gets the final sniped tokens, refunds and interacts with the trigger (supplying bnb / calling it / etc). eg: 0x01effda1c981ca881818cb...18baac8
accounts.disperser: disperser address is the one that spreads bnb for gas to the swarm (for calling later the snipe). can be admin address too.

previewer.dummy (you can delete this line): ext_order_size is what you assume others will be spending. liquidities are the ones added by the token owners to the LP. eg. ext_order_size=1000 -> you assume 1000 BNB will be spend alongside your snipe at liq. addition

swarm.dummy (you can delete this line): rounds is the number of cycles in pow2 of swarming. eg. 4 rounds = 16 accounts (2**4).
swarm.dummy (you can delete this line)2: the more rounds, the more chances of frontrunning other bots you have, at the cost of more bnb spent in gas for txs
swarm.dummy (you can delete this line)3: spread_amount is the bnb you will spread to the swarm so they can call the trigger when liquidity is added. As long as you provide smth that can suffice all txs then OK. If you provide more it will stay there and can be reused for other snipes (or be refunded back)
